text: Carlos Abdala (1930-1976) was a Uruguayan politician and diplomat. He served as Minister of Labour and Social Affairs. Later he was appointed Ambassador in Paraguay, a country where he was mistakingly assassinated by a Croatian Revolutionary Brotherhood terrorists. His son Pablo is currently a national representative. ==References== Category:1920 births Category:1976 deaths Category:Politicians from Montevideo Category:Uruguayan people of Lebanese descent Category:National Party (Uruguay) politicians Category:Ministers of Labor and Social Affairs of Uruguay Category:Ambassadors of Uruguay to Paraguay Category:People murdered in Paraguay Category:Assassinated diplomats Category:Assassinated Uruguayan politicians
title: Carlos Abdala
